issues.description: The problem statementâ€™s UML and constructor specify StockIngredient.price as an int (constructor StockIngredient(String, int, int)), but in the template repository StockIngredient.price is declared as double and its constructor takes a double. The reference solution uses int for price. This mismatch will cause compilation errors and confusion when students implement calculateTotalPrice (summing ints) and contradicts the intended design.
issues.suggested_fix: In the template, change StockIngredient.price and its constructor parameter from double to int, and update getPrice() to return int, so it matches the problem specification and the reference solution.
